com.mededovic.stackcalculator.server

Class CalculatorServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mededovic.stackcalculator.server.CalculatorServer

  • @Path(value="{id}")
public class CalculatorServer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles all of the GET and PUT requests needed for the execution of the Calculator. The CalculatorServer contains multiple useful methods for the execution of the tasks at hand. These methods are: push, peek, pop, add, subtract, multiply and divide. It contains the static LinkedHashMap containing all of the StackCalculators and their ids.
    Author:
    Katarina Mededovic

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response add(int id)
      Removes the top and top-1 of the stack of the calculator with the given id, and replaces them with their sum (i.e. the expression stack[top-1]+stack[top]).
      void addCalculator(int id, StackCalculator sc)
      Returns the status code of the ResponseMessage in question.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response clear()
      Clears the LinkedHashMap containing all of the calculators.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response divide(int id)
      Removes the top and top-1 of the stack of the calculator with the given id, and replaces them with their quotient obtained by using integer division (i.e. the expression stack[top-1]/stack[top]).
      java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Integer,StackCalculator> getCalculators()
      Returns the static LinkedHashMap containing all of the StackCalculators and their ids.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response multiply(int id)
      Removes the top and top-1 of the stack of the calculator with the given id, and replaces them with their product (i.e. the expression stack[top-1]*stack[top]).
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response peek(int id)
      Returns the top of the stack of the calculator with the given id.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response pop(int id)
      Returns the top of the stack of the calculator with the given id, and removes it.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response push(int id, int n)
      Pushes the number n onto the stack of the calculator with the given id.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response subtract(int id)
      Removes the top and top-1 of the stack of the calculator with the given id, and replaces them with their difference (i.e. the expression stack[top-1]-stack[top]).

    • Constructor Detail

      • CalculatorServer

        public CalculatorServer()
        The default constructor for the class CalculatorServer.

      • CalculatorServer

        public CalculatorServer(java.lang.Integer id,
                        StackCalculator sc)
        The constructor for the CalculatorServer class. Used for creating the first StackCalculator, and adding it under the specified key to the static LinkedHashMap field which stores all of the StackCalculators.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the StackCalculator which is added.
        sc - The StackCalculator which is added.
